posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello All,

I come with a concept and a challenge. Admittedly, the challenge is probably down to this being a dumb idea, but bear with me for now, please.

This might come across as somewhat quirky, but I've been wondering recently about constructing LotR's Peregrine Took's hallowed ancestor, Bandobras - the "Bullroarer" - Took. Then I started wondering about the state of my life, but I digress. Many combinations crossed my mind - including PDK, because he reportedly rode a pig into battle against the goblins (and yes, I know the P doesn't stand for pig) - but in the end I thought Barbarian / CoT / Rogue. Barb 'cos he's big and scary (for a halfling), CoT 'cos he's their champion aqgainst the forces of darkness, and Rogue 'cos i) he won't get clattered for an xp penalty and ii) he will get UMD and more juicy skills. But here's the clincher - he should be STR-based: either sword'n'board or 2-handed.

So, there's the concept. And here's the challenge: can anyone make something half-decent from it? I'll be trying as well, but I thought we could do with a brain-teaser.

Cheers

posts.author: theflyingrodent
posts.content:
I see two ways of doing this: the DR way or the AC way.

The dr way: lots of barb for as much DR as possible, maybe even epic DR. A midget using a Warhammer or Scimitar in both hands is both hilarious and effective.

The ac way: sword and board, nly 15 barb for greater rage, lots of cot for feats and maybe even some charisma for wrath.

Depends on what environment it's being designed for.

Rule of thumb:
low magic gear [~+5 ] and monsters don't do insane damage=Dr way.

High magic gear [~ + 10] and monsters do do insane damage =Ac way.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I believe gdl came with that idea back in 06' but he used the popular (and strong) combination of ftr/bard/rdd to produce a 40 str Hin that was using a bastard sword 2-handed, giving flavour in an otherwise well-known build.

I like your idea more though, since a champion of (Tulkas?) - LoTR fans correct me if i'm wrong - seems way more appropriate in my book and more challenging to build as well. You will need at least 16 lvl's of barb to make that work and if you take at least 15 lvl's of CoT you better have some cha in there to make proper use of divine wrath/taunt/intimidate - for flavour - if nothing else. Perhaps a barb 17/cot18/rog5(HS5) or similar.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content: IIRC Bullroarer wielded a club.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks. I get what you say about environment completely, and given that it's me making the request, I should probably have expanded somewhat.

I play SP pretty much all the time (hoping to revive my sojourn into PWs, but my buddy still has some RL issues to deal with, and I wouldn't want to leave him behind), in, I would guess, mostly mid to high-magic environs, but rising to high in mid-epic. By which I mean very little beyond +3 gear/weaponry until epic levels, +5 to approx level 30, then up to +7/8 after about level 35. Essentially, mostly Aielund, some SoU/HotU/SoF, a lot less OC than used to be the case, but but still take it if I do Aribeth's Redemption (depends on alignment and race at the end of the OC). Recently embarked on Swordflight, and am finding it seriously tough but rewarding, and have ventured into Adam Miller's campaign but didn't find it terribly rewarding - probably more to do with me trying classes I was uncomfortable with than the campaign per se.

My instinct is towards the DR route (and not just for the humour), though I always seem drawn to CoT for saves and feats (not so bothered about CHA and Wrath - ugly and unhittable trumps pretty and a bit cross in my book). But I'm open to suggestion - seriously, this is about trying to find a quality, STR-based halfing build. Trying for something different. If it doesn't pan out, at least we've tried, eh?

Btw, I've been thinking about potential starting stats of STR 16, DEX 10, CON 14, WIS 8, INT 14 and CHA 10. I know I'll never get Mighty Rage, but Terrifying's still very much there with a possible Barb 24/26, CoT 10, Rogue 4/6 split.

Oh, and I probably ought to mention that, as a SP proponent in particular, I like a build that's actually playable throughout (as opposed to viable, where the build only fully blossoms at level 40, or thereabouts).

Thanks for the interest.

EDIT: Ninja'd yet again - twice this time! But both by good friends, so thanks, guys

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
If you went with HS instead of rogue you could select Goblinoid and Orc FEs.  Again, this is more along the lines of topical than optimization for general play.

You'll get ninja'd often the more you imbibe distillates.  Or maybe it is a form of jet lag.

posts.author: theflyingrodent
posts.content: https://lotro-wiki.com/index.php/Quest: ... r%27s_Club

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
I believe gdl came with that idea back in 06' but he used the popular (and strong) combination of ftr/bard/rdd to produce a 40 str Hin that was using a bastard sword 2-handed, giving flavour in an otherwise well-known build.

I like your idea more though, since a champion of (Tulkas?) - LoTR fans correct me if i'm wrong - seems way more appropriate in my book and more challenging to build as well. You will need at least 16 lvl's of barb to make that work and if you take at least 15 lvl's of CoT you better have some cha in there to make proper use of divine wrath/taunt/intimidate - for flavour - if nothing else. Perhaps a barb 17/cot18/rog5(HS5) or similar.
Oh cobblers, no such thing as a new idea, eh? Cant't say there's much wrong with the idea of a 40 STR Hin, but you're right, it just doesn't feel right for the Bullroarer, does it? I felt much the same about the thousands of Barb/Bard/RDD builds out there, hence the request.

I confess that I do find your suggested potential split has a lot of appeal - and I hadn't even considered HS before, and that might be a runner.

Oh, and iirc, Tulkas was the Smith in LotR/Silmarillion, and created the dwarves. Can't remember who the hobbits' venerated, I'm afraid (maybe just Longbottom Leaf).

EDIT: Well now I think you're just ninja'ing on purpose! But that might be my imbibing being refined to a caffeine variant (admittedly spiked by another distillate - ran out of the good stuff)

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote:
Oh, and iirc, Tulkas was the Smith in LotR/Silmarillion, and created the dwarves. Can't remember who the hobbits' venerated, I'm afraid (maybe just Longbottom Leaf).
 
The origin of Tolkien's halfling/hobbit race was never really described in any of his works.  They were definitely part of the 2nd children group (i.e. humans) but one would suspect that Ilúvatar merged some elvish influence during their creation judging by their racial features and skills, specifically the shape of the ears, uncanny detection and light-footedness. The darker skin and wavy hair would seem to contradict an association with the fair-skinned elven race but when mixing races, there could have been some unexpected dominance of genetics. Men never had any of the Valar or Maiar champion them so apparently, neither did the halflings.

Actually, it was Aulë that forced his dwarven creation into sleep until the elves were born after threatening to smash them with his hammer for going against Ilúvatar's master plan.  Tulkas was a badass champion of Valinor without any weapon other than his laughter and rage that even scared the crap out of Melkor/Morgoth when Morgoth started restructuring the lands and seas of Middle Earth then fled when he heard Tulkas approaching.

I haven't heard mention of the Silmarillion for a very long time though have wished that Peter Jackson would have tried to produce that Tolkien epic novel in film instead of The Hobbit after LotR. He's not getting any younger and neither am I.

The darker skin and wavy hair would seem to contradict an association with the fair-skinned elven race but when mixing races, there could have been some unexpected dominance of genetics. Men never had any of the Valar or Maiar champion them so apparently, neither did the halflings.

Actually, it was Aulë that forced his dwarven creation into sleep until the elves were born after threatening to smash them with his hammer for going against Ilúvatar's master plan.  Tulkas was a badass champion of Valinor without any weapon other than his laughter and rage that even scared the crap out of Melkor/Morgoth when Morgoth started restructuring the lands and seas of Middle Earth then fled when he heard Tulkas approaching.

I haven't heard mention of the Silmarillion for a very long time though have wished that Peter Jackson would have tried to produce that Tolkien epic novel in film instead of The Hobbit after LotR. He's not getting any younger and neither am I.
Agreed. I always found it an underrated and fascinating novel - and more Old Testament Biblical in its style and scope - thus more episodic in its approach, which would suit Mr Jackson, I'd think.

And thanks for the correction. Tulkas would indeed make a good Barbarian deity, then.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: To be blunt, that AB is not very good, and the AC is really bad. The old RDD version may be cliche, but there's a good reason for that.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks for the input, Empyre. I know there's been some recent discussion about power-building and builds for RP, and this was always one of the latter. Yes, I'm looking for the best STR build available, but within certain parameters - and there's nothing to suggest that the Bullroarer had any arcane inclination or draconian blood in him. I gave my initial critique of the character traits earlier on, but if you have another take, excellent. I've been happy to see Harper Scout now featuring instead of Rogue, because it's a better conceptual fit - and that was part of the point: it was about marrying the concept with a different sort of build. I appreciate that reason has to be fairly flexible in the context of a creating a fictitious character in a separate and different fictitious world, but if we can't suspend disbelief, who on earth can?

Regardless, cheers!

posts.author: theflyingrodent
posts.content:
That was a rough DR and Barb heavy version of the build. If you went more COT in epic levels [6 great ability feats] , chopped off 5 con and the 3 epic DR feats and went for more strength, you could conceivably get 32 strength for 46 AB with a plain club as opposed to 41.

But even then, you wouldn't equal RDD in the AB+AC department. 8 strength and 4AC for the sacrifice of 10 levels basically cant be beaten by anything else, let alone all the other stuff. RDD is just that: cliche.

And depending on what you're trying to achieve, it may also be not necessary. :)

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I usually roleplay an RDD not as somebody who is part dragon, but as someone who is really strong. That is easier to do now that there is always a cloak hiding the wings. You could probably also roleplay the Bard song as something other than singing.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Cheers mate. You know how much I love some of your RDD creations - going back to my first ever request here (the old Non-Shooty, Non-Magicky Elf one) - and you're right, it's easy to forget you've got wings (though it still surprises me that Aribeth doesn't even notice in the more intimate moments in the tale of her Redemption!). I'm just looking for something more..."Shirey" here. An homage, if you will.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content: When you decide to test this toon, use the console command " dm_spawncreature x3_hvywarhorse2 " in DebugMode, mount the horse and take a close-up screenie of Bullroarer on his steed, but don't save (it's just for giggles and posterity).  It should work unless the module has specifically disabled horse scripts or been created before v1.69.  Not sure whether the horse gets scaled for the small race passenger or not during the mount action, though.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Or, given my technical prowess, if I test in Aielund there are horses available for riding in part 2. Either way, will do!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Now I know it's been a while, but I've been giving this one a bit of thought lately (mostly because I'm about to finalize the re-working of GDL's Hearth Guard, so wanted to tidy up other loose ends). I've taken on board Valerfor's suggested split - Barb 17 / CoT 18 / HS 5 and examined Rodent's first thoughts, as well as - in particular - Max's Champion of the Tribes (I'll spell out its location when this is finalized).

There are some issues with the draft below, not least the AC and the lack of a "complete" detection skill, but I'd value your thoughts before taking him out for a ride. Particularly with respect to whether SkF in either/both Taunt or Intimidate or Expertise would trump the benefits from Power Attack (and thereby Cleave) - though Toughness might also be vulnerable to potential exchange. I'd also appreciate your thoughts on whether boosts to CHA might be preferable to STR ones (for Terry Rage and Divine Wrath purposes). I confess, if not for the RP nature of the build I'd have used the HS bonus feats for either a couple of Great CHAs or ESkFs in Taunt and Intimidate.

Anyway, I'd be grateful for your (printable) thoughts.

Bullroarer Took - Barb 17 / CoT 18 / HS 5
Halfling, non-evil, non-lawful
PvM 1-40

STR 14 (30)
DEX 12
CON 14
WIS 8
INT 14
CHA 14

HPs: 534
Saves: F 36, W 28, R31 (+2 v Fear-type effects, +4 v traps)
AC: (naked) 22 (LShield + FPlate) 29
DR: 3/-
BAB: 30
AB: (melee, club) 45 (ranged) 33 (34 with thrown weapons)
SPs: 222. Disc 43 (53), Intimidate 43 (45), Listen 23 (28), Lore 6 (8), Persuade 8 (10), Search 4 (6), Taunt 43 (45), Tumble 40 (41)

LEVELLING

1 B1 - Heavy Armour
2 B2
3 B3 - WF: Club
4 B4 - STR+1
5 B5
6 B6 - Power Attack
7 B7
8 B8 - STR+1
9 CoT1 - Imp Crit: Club
10 CoT2 - Cleave
11 CoT3

13 CoT5
14 CoT6 - KD
15 CoT7 - Iron Will
16 CoT8 - STR+1 / IKD
17 B9
18 B10 - Alertness
19 B11

22 HS1 - FE1: Goblinoids
23 B14
24 B15 - STR+1 / Terrifying Rage
25 CoT9
26 CoT10 - EWF: Club
27 HS2 - GStr II
28 CoT11 - STR+1
29 CoT12
30 CoT13 - GStr III
31 CoT14 - Armour Skin
32 HS3 - STR+1
33 B16 - GStr IV
34 CoT15
35 CoT16 - GStr V
36 CoT 17 - STR+1
37 HS4
38 CoT18 - GStr VI / Epic Prowess
39 HS5 - FE2: Orcs
40 B17 - STR+1

Over to you splendid people!

Cheers

21 - Rog(1): Grt STR (22)
22 - Brb(13)
23 - Brb(14)
24 - Brb(15): STR+1 (23), Terrifying Rage
25 - Brb(16)
26 - CoT(9)
27 - CoT(10): Grt STR (24), EWF: Club
28 - CoT(11): STR+1 (25)
29 - CoT(12)
30 - CoT(13): Grt STR (26)
31 - CoT(14): Armor Skin
32 - CoT(15): STR+1 (27)
33 - CoT(16): Grt STR (28)
34 - CoT(17)
35 - CoT(18): Epic Prowess
36 - Brb(17): STR+1 (29), Grt STR (30)
37 - Brb(18)
38 - Rog(2): {Class: Evasion}
39 - Brb(19): Grt STR (31)
40 - Brb(20): STR+1 (32) {Class: DR 4/-)

HP max: 552
Saves F/W/R: 38/25/31
Add'l saves: Traps +5, Fear +2
BAB: 30 (4 APR)
AB (max, naked): 46 (mundane club), 34 (thrown), 33 (other ranged)
AC (naked/mundane fplate/lshield): 22/31

Skills (230) - Discipline 43(54), Intimidate 43(42), Listen 40(45), Taunt 43(42), Tumble 40(41), UMD 21(20)



Though I can appreciate your efforts to somehow express Bandobras' bias towards certain races, HS seems an unnecessarily poor fit and hard to reconcile the RP value.  

After all, both Ride skill and Mounted Combat are missing, already one concession to what would be a more accurate roleplay interpretation.  Likewise, investing your ability spread into a 1x/day short duration pseudo-omnipotent feat I feel is an act of futility for a personality I wouldn't expect to be all that charismatic to begin with. 

If you want to use Divine Wrath with a sorc's Tenser for some extra oomph, that'll work okay but mostly because the duration will be long enough to take advantage.  2-3 rounds just won't cut it and you certainly won't be gearing up with CHA-boost properties over +AC and +STR ones.  My advice: stick with Sacred Defense and the bonus feats.  That's a win-win.

In the example posted, I paid little/no attention to either the order of feats (no time, sry Stagmeister) or any other build suggestions... so if it matches in any way then, by coincidence, like minds think alike. (or perhaps... warped minds suffer the same malady?).

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks very much, Hip. Interestingly enough, Barb/CoT/Rogue was my initial concept in the OP, so I'm more than happy to buy into that! I hadn't built with HS before, and you know what it's like when you get a new toy - you just want to play with that one for a while. Equally, the starting stats are closer to those I was initially looking at, so again, pleased to take on board. Of course, losing HS also frees up a couple of feats, as well as a sizeable dollop of skills points, allowing for a complete detection skill and some UMD, with the Rogue addition.

All in all, great feedback! I'll muck around with it a bit and get back to the Guild after testing.

Cheers

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Now this is a hell of a necro, but I do like me some completeness. I've just finished taking the Bullroarer through the OC and MTS and had an absolute blast with him. I have 2 confessions, however. First, I forgot to take any screenshots - but I will be taking him out again for the fun of him, so I'll try to remember next time. Second, because his AC was pretty dreadful, I didn't take club as his weapon. It's a two-hander for Hins, and he really needed a shield. Also, quality clubs are very thin on the ground (who'd have thunk it?). Instead, I went for mace. I figured it was in the spirit of the build, and I could both use a shield and pick up more quality items. Below is the final build I went with. And yes, at least one of the Expertise girls would have made sense, but hey, we're talking about a very cross, lunatic hobbit who rides a pig full-tilt into battle - sense doesn't come into it.

Bandobras Took - "The Bullroarer"
Barbarian 28/ Champion of Tulkas 10/ Rogue 2
Hin: non-evil, non-lawful
1-40 PvM

Stats
STR 16 (32)
DEX 12
CON 14
WIS 8
INT 14
CHA 8

AC: (naked) 22, (full plate) 30, (+med shield) 32
DR: 6/-
Speed: +10%
Saves: Fort 31, Will 21, Reflex 26. All +4 v spells, +2 v fear-type spells
Sneak Attack: 1d6 (oooh!)
Skills: 246. Disable Trap 3 (5), Discipline 43 (54), Intimidate 43 (55), Listen 43 (48), Open Lock 1 (2), Search 3 (5), Spellcraft (cc) 18 (20), Tumble 40 (41), UMD 34 (33). (You could always take a full Taunt skill instead of the Spellcraft and bits and bobs of DTrap, OLock, and Search, but I wasn't feeling very "taunty". Likewise, you could swap Taunt in for Listen, but I like at least one detection skill.)

I'm not moving the Bullroarer to the Epic forum because, while he's huge fun to play, he's not what you'd call optimized - however you define the word (oh, and that means I don't have to be arsed typing up the skills schedule). It didn't help that Epic Skill Focus isn't available as a bonus feat, and I wanted it, otherwise I'd have taken Terrifying Rage at 24 and had at least 4 more CoT levels (dropping 4 Barb, obvs). I can say that he'll put a smile on your face, though!

Cheers

EDIT: I defy anyone not to laugh out loud when the Bullroarer emerges into a ring of 8 or 9 Frost Giants and, rather than flee, bellows his ire at them then smashes the crap out of their kneecaps at speed until they're all big gloopy popsicles. Unless you're their mum, I suppose.

EDIT 2: Decided to include a full skills schedule after all
